text: Thirteen athletes from France competed in six sports at the 1896 Summer Olympics. France won the fourth-most gold medals with 5 and the fourth-most total medals with 11. Cycling was the sport in which the French competitors had the most success, as they completely dominated the field. The French team had 27 entries in 18 events, winning 11 medals. ==Medalists== {| class="wikitable sortable" style="font-size:90%" |- !Medal !Name !Sport !Event !Date |- | rowspan=3| | rowspan=3| | rowspan=3|Cycling | Men's 10 km | |- | Men's time trial | |- | Men's sprint | |- | | || Cycling | Men's 100 km | |- | | || Fencing | Men's foil | |- | | || Athletics | Men's triple jump | |- | | || Cycling | Men's 10 km | |- | | || Fencing | Men's foil | |- | | || Fencing | Men's masters foil | |- | | || Athletics | Men's 1500 m | |- | | || Cycling | Men's sprint | |} ==Athletics== The five French athletes won 2 medals between them. Tuffère appears to have entered the 100 metres but not started; some sources have André Tournois in the first heat of the 100 metres instead of Grisel.Butler, Maynard. The Olympic Games. In Mallon & Widlund, pp. 37–41.Ekkehard zur Megede : The history of Olympic athletics. Volume 1: 1896-1936. Verlag Bartels & Wernitz KG, Berlin, 2nd edition 1970. Grisel entered the triple jump, but did not start. ; Track and road events {|class="wikitable sortable" |- !rowspan="2"|Athlete !rowspan="2"|Events !colspan="2"|Heat !colspan="2"|Final |- !Result !Rank !Result !Rank |- |Adolphe Grisel |100 m |align="center"|Unknown |align="center"|Unknown |align="center" colspan=2|Did not advance |- |Adolphe Grisel |rowspan=2|400 m |align="center"|Unknown |align="center"|Unknown |align="center" colspan=2|Did not advance |- |Frantz Reichel |align="center"|Unknown |align="center"|Unknown |align="center" colspan=2|Did not advance |- |Albin Lermusiaux |rowspan=2|800 m |align="center"|2:16.6 |align="center"|1 Q |align="center" colspan=2| |- |Georges de la Nézière |align="center"|Unknown |align="center"|Unknown |align="center" colspan=2|Did not advance |- |Albin Lermusiaux |1500 m |align="center" colspan=2|n/a |align="center"|4:37.0 |align="center"| |- |Frantz Reichel |110 m hurdles |align="center"|Unknown |align="center"| 3 |align="center" colspan=2| Did not advance |- |Albin Lermusiaux |rowspan=2|marathon |align="center" colspan=2 |align="center" colspan=2| |} ; Field events {|class="wikitable sortable" |- !rowspan="2"|Athlete !rowspan="2"|Events !colspan="2"|Final |- !Result !Rank |- |Adolphe Grisel |Discus throw |align="center"|Unknown |align="center"|Unknown |- |Alexandre Tuffère |Triple jump |align="center"|12.70 |align="center"| |- |Adolphe Grisel |rowspan=2|Long jump |align="center"|5.83 |align="center"|5 |- |Alexandre Tuffère |align="center"|5.98 |align="center"|4 |} ==Cycling== Leon Flameng and Paul Masson France dominated the cycling events, taking 4 of the 6 gold medals. Three were won by Paul Masson who won every event he entered, with Léon Flameng adding the fourth as well as a silver and a bronze. One of the two won each event that a Frenchman contested; the two gold medals won by other countries were in competitions that Masson and Flameng did not enter. {|class=wikitable style="font-size:90%" |- !Athlete !Event !Time / Distance !Rank |- |rowspan=3|Paul Masson |Time trial |align="center"|24.0 |align="center"| |- |Sprint |align="center"|4:58.2 |align="center"| |- |10 km |align="center"|17:54.2 |align="center"| |- |rowspan=4|Léon Flameng |Time trial |align="center"|27.0 |align="center"|5 |- |Sprint |align="center"|Unknown |align="center"| |- |10 km |align="center"|17:54.8 |align="center"| |- |100 km |align="center"|3:08:19.2 |align="center"| |} ==Fencing== Group of French and Greek fencers at 1896 Summer Olympics The final sword match 1896 Summer Olympics The French fencers were held in high regard prior to the Games; Gravelotte and Callot validated those expectations in the amateur foil competition. Each went undefeated in their pool, advancing to face each other in the final. Gravelotte won the first-to-3 bout. Surprisingly, however, Perronet lost to the Greek Leonidas Pyrgos in the only match of the masters competition. {| class="wikitable" style="font-size:90%;" |- !rowspan="2"|Athlete !rowspan="2"|Event !colspan="2"|Record !colspan="2"|Touches !rowspan="2"|Final Rank |- !Wins !Losses !For !Against |- |Eugène-Henri Gravelotte |rowspan=3|Foil |align="center"|4 |align="center"|0 |align="center"|12 |align="center"|7 |align="center"| |- |Henri Callot |align="center"|3 |align="center"|1 |align="center"|11 |align="center"|7 |align="center"| |- |Henri Delaborde |align="center"|1 |align="center"|2 |align="center"|5 |align="center"|8 |align="center"|5 |- |Joanni Perronet |Masters foil |align="center"|0 |align="center"|1 |align="center"|1 |align="center"|3 |align="center"| |} {| class=wikitable ! Total || 8 || 4 || .667 |} ==Gymnastics== Grisel competed in the parallel bars in the gymnastics program. The competitions had no formal scoring, the judges merely selecting the winner and runner-up. Grisel was neither in this competition. {|class=wikitable style="font-size:90%" |- !Athlete !Event !Result !Rank |- |Adolphe Grisel |Parallel bars |align="center"|Unknown |align="center"|Unknown |} ==Shooting== Lermusiaux entered the military rifle event in the shooting program. His score and placing are unknown. {|class=wikitable style="font-size:90%" |- !Athlete !Event !Hits !Score !Rank |- |Albin Lermusiaux |200 m military rifle |align="center"|Unknown |align="center"|Unknown |align="center"|Unknown |} ==Tennis== Only the last name of the French tennis player in 1896 is known. He was defeated in the first round of the singles tournament. {|class=wikitable style="font-size:90%" |- !rowspan="2"|Athlete !rowspan="2"|Event !First round !Quarterfinals !Semifinals !colspan="2"|Finals |- !style="line- height:1em"|Opposition Result !style="line-height:1em"|Opposition Result !style="line-height:1em"|Opposition Result !style="line-height:1em"|Opposition Result !Rank |- |J.
